intro: Cheniella touranensis, commonly known as the Touranensis Cheniella, is a rare and endemic plant species native to specific regions in Iran. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its delicate, aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing adaptations to withstand harsh climatic conditions. Its flowers are small and clustered, often appearing in white or pale yellow, and it produces seeds that are dispersed by wind. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Cheniella touranensis is considered a valuable subject for botanical research and conservation efforts.
